qas.question: Matthew described that who was present at the Crucifixion?
The three gospels speak of the presence of which priests?
How many people were crucified with Jesus?

answers.text: two robbers crucified, one on Jesus' right and one on his left

qas.question: Name one other group present at the Crucifixion?
Who were the women keeping watch over according to his acquanitances?
How many acquaintances are named in the Gospels?
What had the scribes and elders been assembled for according to the women?

plausible_answers.text: one on Jesus' right and one on his left

qas.question: Where were the elders standing when Jesus was crucified?
What was the attidude of the scribes when watching the crucifixion?

context: The Gospel of Matthew describes <a0_0>many women<a0_0/> at the crucifixion, some of whom are named in the Gospels. Apart from these women, the <b6_0>three<b6_0/> Synoptic Gospels speak of the presence of others: "<a1_0>the chief priests<a1_0/>, with the scribes and elders"; <a2_0>two robbers crucified, <b8_0>one on Jesus' right and one on his left<b8_0/><a2_0/>, whom the Gospel of Luke presents as the penitent thief and the <b9_0>impenitent<b9_0/> thief; "<a3_0>the soldiers<a3_0/>", "the centurion and those who were with him, keeping watch over <b5_0>Jesus<b5_0/>"; passers-by; "bystanders", "the crowds that had assembled for <b7_0>this spectacle<b7_0/>"; and "his <a4_0>acquaintances<a4_0/>"
